title: How much Fps would I get with Nvidia Geforce 720 2GB Deticated Graphics?
body:
Hello, I am a customer looking for a decent cheap graphics card and this one came to me. How well would I run League with it?

Edit: I'd like to know what I'd get with very low, low and medium.

replies.body: Very high end/low end graphics cards have terrible value for performance. Take a gtx 950 for 150$ for exemple, it is worlds apart from that gt 720 and can enable you to play any current game. If your computer was pre built make sure your power supply is strong enough for your future card and that you won't want to change every piece of component in your computer 1 at a time after your gpu upgrade. Wait sales/ buy used/ compare. To compare you can do something as simple as write gt 720 league of legends on youtube, saw a guy with gt 720 run very high 70 fps. If you think you might be interested in more than just league you might want to consider a bigger/more thought investment as it would have a much better value for your money. Check your power supply!
Honestly if you get that card you are wasting your money. Get a 960 and stick with that for a few years
its a real crap card compared to my crap card (mine runs at 175 fps uncapped, despite being pretty bad), yours should run between approx. 25 and 80 fps depending on high or low graphics setting
If so, how would it do in comparison to the 2GB AMD Radeon R5 330 DDR3 FH Graphics?

[Try this comparison.](http://gpu.userbenchmark.com/Compare/Nvidia-GeForce-GT-720M-vs-Nvidia-GeForce-9800-GT/m7921vsm7716)

I'm assuming you mean a laptop's integrated graphics. I'd consider the 9800 GT a good benchmark for league, my friend gets about 60fps on max settings.

Play around with different cards until you get a super duper one that works. I'm using a HD 7790 1GB which is overkill for league. Most desktop cards of 1GB GDDR5 kill it. Even older GTX 460's are overkill for league.
you'd get 60 stable on very low, low, and medium, and you might get 60 stable on high.
